site.title: Home - Bayou Arts
site.description: Making Art Work The Bayou Regional Arts Council works to support arts access in the Assumption, Lafourche, St. Charles, St. James, St. John the Baptist, and Terrebonne parishes through grants, workshops, and networking opportunities for artists and organizations. hero.title: About - Bayou Arts
hero.subtitle: About Us The Bayou Regional Arts Council is a 501(c)(3) non-profit agency in existence since August of 2015. We serve Terrebonne, Lafourche, Assumption, St. James, St. John and St. Charles Parishes. About Us The Bayou Regional Arts Council is a 501(c)(3) non-profit agency in existence since August of 2015. hero.title: Programs - Bayou Arts
hero.subtitle: Programs The Bayou Regional Arts Council offers grants to fund art projects and programs that support our mission statement. Programs must submit grant applications that follow the guidelines of the Louisiana and Terrebonne Parish Arts Funding programs. Programs The Bayou Regional Arts Council offers grants to fund art projects and programs that support our mission

hero.title: Grants - Bayou Arts
hero.subtitle: Louisiana Project Grants ABOUTLouisiana Project Grants are available to non-profit organizations within the Bayou Regional Arts Council 6-parish service region, to support arts and culture programs. Applications are open May 5th - June 27th, 2025. Draft deadline June 13th, 2025.The last day to have the CDC look over and give feedback on drafts in Submittable

sections.text: Louisiana Project Grants ABOUTLouisiana Project Grants are available to non-profit organizations within the Bayou Regional Arts Council 6-parish service region, to support arts and culture programs. Applications are open May 5th - June 27th, 2025. Draft deadline June 13th, 2025.The last day to have the CDC look over and give feedback on drafts in Submittable
Application Period:  Terrebonne Parish Arts Funding Program will not be returning in 2025.
Final Reports FY24 for Grant Recipients Due Date: March 1st, 2025.
Louisiana Project Grant FY26 Grant Application
Louisiana Project Grants FY26 Grant Guidelines

hero.title: Events - Bayou Arts
hero.subtitle: Events Events are a great way to meet other local artists, display your artwork and support our organization and the artists we serve. Please join us at any of our events and support the arts! Thank you to our sponsors!

hero.title: Bayou Arts Fest - Bayou Arts
hero.subtitle: 2025 BAYOU ARTS FEST Dive into a vibrant tapestry of creativity at the Bayou Arts Fest, where culture and community converge! Join us in Downtown Houma on Saturday, October 11, 2025 from 10am to 11pm, for a celebration that transcends boundaries and embraces diversity. We are thrilled to announce the return of the Culture Collective.

sections.text: 2025 BAYOU ARTS FEST Dive into a vibrant tapestry of creativity at the Bayou Arts Fest, where culture and community converge! Join us in Downtown Houma on Saturday, October 11, 2025 from 10am to 11pm, for a celebration that transcends boundaries and embraces diversity. We are thrilled to announce the return of the Culture Collective.

hero.title: Support Our Efforts - Bayou Arts
hero.subtitle: Support Our Efforts Support Our Efforts We’re excited to announce that the Bayou Regional Arts Council is looking for a location to create a Community Arts Center. We are in the process of negotiating to acquiring the old Park Theater or another location in the Downtown Area! With your help, we’ll renovate this historic venue

sections.text: Support Our Efforts Support Our Efforts We’re excited to announce that the Bayou Regional Arts Council is looking for a location to create a Community Arts Center. We are in the process of negotiating to acquiring the old Park Theater or another location in the Downtown Area! With your help, we’ll renovate this historic venue

	Hurricane Ida / Crisis Relief
Keep one to three feet away from anyone who is coughing or sneezing.
Avoid touching eyes, nose, and mouth.
Cover your mouth and nose into your bent elbow if you cough or sneeze.
If you have a fever, seek medical care early.
Stock up on non-perishable foods and medicines.
Consider purchasing a mask, gloves, and cleaning supplies.
Stay informed of the latest developments. and follow advice from your health care provider.
UCLA has published very helpful advice for protecting your physical and mental health.
Encourage sick employees to stay home.
Advise employees to take safety measures when traveling.
Consider alternate streams of revenue or markets if public events and classes are canceled. Here’s a great compilation of resources for freelance artists.
Stock up on basic tools or supplies in the event that you lose access to your regular supply chains.
Plan for kids’ schools or daycares closing
Visit CERF+’s page on business continuity, which has links to resources on business emergency and continuity plans, including Open for Business’ robust suite of documents.
Watch the “Artists In a Time of Global Pandemic” webinar to learn about additional resources.
Look into a Small Business Administration low interest disaster loan
Find more sources of funding in our compilation of other arts organizations with standing emergency relief funds
Review the CDC’s Interim Guidance for Businesses and Employers to Plan and Respond to Coronavirus Disease 2019.
Familiarize yourself with the CDC’s Preparing Communities for Potential Spread of Coronavirus guidelines and recommendations.
Stay in touch with state and local health agencies for guidance specific to your location
Be aware of the World Health Organization’s recommendations for planning mass gatherings.
Watch the Event Planning Alliance’s “Preparing Your Organization for the Corona Virus Disease Outbreak” webinar here.
Review the Americans for the Arts list of ways the arts and culture community can prepare here.
The Nonprofit Finance Fund has a list of steps nonprofits should take right now.

sections.text: Hurricane Ida / Crisis Relief - Bayou Arts

Hurricane Ida and Crisis Relief Resources The Bayou Regional Arts Council would like to provide various resources for those impacted by the effects of Hurricane Ida both on a regional and statewide scope. RESOURCES211 Louisiana Statewide NetworkDisasterAssistance.govOpportunity Louisiana – Hurricane ReliefSmall Business Assistance Disaster ReliefFEMA – Hurricane IdaLafourche – Houma Resources (Food, Gas, Cell Reception, Roof
Hurricane Ida and Crisis Relief Resources
Lafourche – Houma Resources (Food, Gas, Cell Reception, Roof Securing)
Governor’s Office of Homeland Security and Preparedness
Louisiana Department of Child and Family Services
National Coalition for Arts Preparedness and Emergency Response
NCAPER Arts Field Guide to Federal Disaster Relief
The Adolph & Esther Gottlieb Emergency Grant
Blue Cross Blue Shield Foundation Community Crisis & Response Grants
Hero Initiative – Assistance for a comic book writer, penciler, inker, colorist or letterer on a work-for-hire bases for a minimum of 10 years.
Jazz Foundation of America Musicians’ Emergency Fund – Housing assistance, pro-bono medical care, disaster relief and direct financial support.
Musicians Foundation – Grants eligible to musician in a time of acute need.
The Pen Writers Fund – Emergency fun for professional writers in financial need.
